name: places/ChIJzb6NZa9ZwokRc8K9hrqg1wM
formattedAddress: 104 W 29th St #3, New York, NY 10001, USA
adrFormatAddress: 104 W 29th St #3, New York, NY 10001-5310, USA

originalText.text:
Found out about Birch Family Services through a government job agency called WorkForce1 at a so called job fair, I passed the first screening by Birch Family Services and was invited for a second interview yet after the second interview I had to meet with a supervisor at the location I was suppose to be station to watch over patients with a wide range of different mental disabilities before being hired so I counted this as yet a third interview which I absolutely understand considering the seriousness of the position, now what really bother me and made me pass on this company is the fact I had attended a total of 3 interviews and not once none of the supervisors brought up the subject of payment, they all spoke about the toughness of the job, about the extensive training required, and punctuality, but not once mentioning payment for the services I would be providing.
This situation made me think that they probably were not interested in paying a fair price for my services and the fact I came to Birch through a government Job agency double that suspicion.
So after a few days I received a voice message saying Birch was highly interested in hiring me which I kindly replied by  email somewhat like this "Thanks, but No thanks Birch"
My personal opinion is that a situation such a this says something about how the company operates, no doubt liking your job matters yet no one wishes to do it for free or very little.
I've had my fill with companies like this one, companies that tries to make the most money out of their employees with tactics such as this, not talking about payment until nearly hiring the person so the person would take whatever you give.
Yeah, Right, not going to work with me Birch, not this time.
With a broken heart my job search continues...

originalText.text: I wouldn't say I hated it.I loved it. It was better.

text.text: I wouldn't say I hated it.I loved it. It was better.

originalText.text: This group goes above and beyond to help individuals with learning disabilities obtain the services they need.

originalText.text: Services are great just like the people that work there
